instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message:
Replaced a screen on macbook air 11 inch 2012. Unfortunately had an accident with fan screw holder on the motherboard. (Very lame of me, I know!). Now macbook doesnt start from battery or hold charge. Starts with adapter plugged in. Shows battery percentage. Battery percentage goes up. As soon as disconnect magsafe, switches off.
Did NVRAM and CMS reset. Getting 8V on pins 1,2,3 of J6950 battery connector.
What did I fuck up now?

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message:
Tried another battery but its not from my favourite supplier.
Ordered a new good battery will test again tomorrow.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message: Same problem with new battery. Bummer... Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message: Found it. Explosion on R6920! Replaced and everything working. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message: So you replaced the LCD without disconnecting the battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3208 doesnt stay on battery
threads.message: No but I might have connected battery before connecting back LCD on reassembly :S
